alert.note: Alert for Cherokee; Forsyth; North Fulton (Georgia) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued June 06 at 4:50PM EDT by NWS Atlanta
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of southeastern Cherokee, northwestern Forsyth and north central Fulton Counties through 515 PM EDT... At 449 PM EDT, a strong thunderstorm was over Milton, or 8 miles west of Cumming, moving northeast at 15 mph. HAZARD...40 to 50 mph wind, frequent cloud to ground lightning and heavy rain. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Expect minor damage to tree limbs and blowing around of light, unsecured objects. Heavy rain may cause temporary street flooding especially in poor drainage areas. Locations impacted include... Cumming, Alpharetta, Milton, Free Home, Drew, Holbrook, Lathemtown, Ducktown, Hightower and Birmingham. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...50 MPH
info.instruction: People outdoors should seek shelter immediately. If you can hear thunder, you are close enough to be struck by lightning. Motorists should slow down and be prepared for possible loss of control due to hydroplaning.
